text:
LOS 20.0
For a change in an exchange rate, we can calculate the percentage appreciation (price
goes up) or depreciation (price goes down) of the base currency. For example, a decrease
in the USD/EUR exchange rate from 1.44 to 1.42 represents a depreciation of the EUR
relative to the USD of 1.39% (1.42 / 1.44 – 1 = -0.0139) because the price of a euro
has fallen 1.39%.
